page.shortlink: dt field Data Field Control Properties
page.description: Properties are available for all form controls that are bound to a table field, variable, or a calculated value. Examples include:

case.description: Check boxes
Combo boxes
List boxes
Memo controls
Radio buttons
Rich Text Memo controls
Tree Controls
Type-In (text) controls

case.title: Displayed Value
case.description: The text displayed on the form.

case.title: Internal Value
case.description: The actual value stored internally.
case.note: You cannot read the value of a blank numeric or logical field. If a field on a form or browse is edited, the .text property immediately reflects what the user typed into the field, but the .value property is only set when the field looses focus.

case.title: Object Name
case.description: Any text description that you wish. The default value is the field name.

case.title: Field
case.description: The table field or variable that supplies the control writes to.

case.title: Field Type
case.description: A wide variety of different formatting options to display the data and any selection options.

case.title: Color Equation
case.description: You can assign Color Equations to your layouts. For example, you might have negative numbers appear in red to draw attention to them. A color equation is a conditional expression that determines the font color and field background color depending on the value of the displayed data. Click the button to open the Color Equation Genie. If you set a conditional font or color equation, the settings override any other font and color settings you have defined.

case.title: Font Equation
case.description: You can assign Font Equations to your layouts. For example, you might have negative numbers appear in bold to draw attention to them. A font equation sets different fonts, point sizes, and styles depending on the value of the displayed data. Click to display the Font Equation Genie to help you define the necessary font equation.

case.title: Read Only
case.description: When checked prevents the user from modifying any data visible in the field.

case.title: Tab Stop
case.description: When checked causes allows the user to tab to the field.

case.title: Allow Growth when Printing
case.description: When checked allows the data to expand to fit on reports.

case.title: Always on Top
case.description: When checked the control is always on the top-most level of the form layout. No other form elements will over lap it.

case.title: Always Modeless
case.description: When checked the control will always be in modeless data entry mode regardless of what the form's setting.

case.title: Hide
case.description: When checked the field becomes invisible.

case.title: Disable
case.description: When checked the field becomes inaccessible.

case.title: Allow Shrinking
case.description: When checked allows the data to shrink to fit on reports.

case.title: Don't Spell Check
case.description: When checked prevents the field from being spell checked.

case.title: Show RTF Toolbar
case.description: Rich Text Memo fields only. Whether to display the RTF Toolbar when the field has focus.

case.title: Fly-over Effects
case.description: Check Fly-over Effects and click Set Fly-over Appearance to set horizontal alignment, vertical alignment, border, fill, font, and shadow properties to take effect when the cursor is above the field. Fly-over properties are not settable through Xbasic.

case.title: Horizontal Alignment
case.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the data in the field to "Left", "Center", or "Right".

case.title: Vertical Alignment
case.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the data in the field to "Top", "Center", or "Bottom".

case.title: Word Wrap
case.description: When checked allows text to word wrap to multiple lines. If disabled, text will be clipped to the field's width.

case.title: Width
case.description: The width of the display in characters. This value can be greater than or less than the table field's width.

case.title: Decimal Places
case.description: For numeric fields, the number of characters to display after the decimal point; not necessarily equal to the number of decimal characters defined for the table field.

case.title: Format Style
case.description: Optionally, select one of many data display formats.

case.title: Border Style
case.description: Sets the border line style.

case.title: Border Color
case.description: Sets the border line color (using a color name or RGB value ).

case.title: Border Edge Shape
case.description: Sets the shape of the border.

case.title: Border Width
case.description: The width of the border line in pixels.

case.title: Show Left, Right, Top, Bottom
case.description: For edge shape "Square" determines which sides of the rectangle will display. For other edge shapes, determines which corners will be square or styled.
case.example: :formname.fieldname.border.has_bottom_edge as L :formname.fieldname.border.has_left_edge as L :formname.fieldname.border.has_right_edge as L :formname.fieldname.border.has_top_edge as L

case.title: Shadow Style
case.description: Determines how much the shadow will be offset and its degree of shading.

case.title: Shadow Color
case.description: Sets the shadow color (using a color name or RGB value ).

case.title: Background Style
case.description: The fill color mode and translucency of the control's background.

case.title: Fill
case.description: The style and color(s) of the control's background.
case.example: :formname.controlname.fill.backcolor as C :formname.controlname.fill.forecolor as C :formname.controlname.fill.style as C

case.title: Font
case.description: Sets the font.

case.title: Size
case.description: Sets the point size.

case.title: Bold, Italic, Underline, Strikeout
case.description: When checked set the named attribute.
case.example: :formname.fieldname.font.bold as L :formname.fieldname.font.italic as L :formname.fieldname.font.strikeout as L :formname.fieldname.font.underline as L

case.title: Color
case.description: Sets the text color (using a color name or RGB value ).

case.title: Left
case.description: Sets the horizontal position of the control.

case.title: Top
case.description: Sets the vertical position of the control.

case.title: Width
case.description: Sets the width of the control.

case.title: Height
case.description: Sets the height of the control.

case.title: Anchor
case.description: Determines the way the tabbed control will or will not stretch as the base form is resized. Possible attachment points are: 1 = top and right 2 = top, left, and right 4 = bottom and left 5 = bottom and right 6 = bottom, left, and right 8 = top, bottom, and left 9 = top, bottom, and right 10 = top, bottom, left, and right

case.title: Bubble Help Text
case.description: The bubble help text that appears when you place the cursor over the control.

case.title: Help Source File
case.description: The path to and name of the compiled help file that contains the help topics.

case.title: Topic Name
case.description: The name of the help topic in a compiled help file.

case.title: Chapter Name
case.description: The name of the chapter name in an Alpha Anywhere help file.

case.title: Topic Name
case.description: The name of the help topic in a compiled help file.

case.title: Right Click Menu
case.description: Sets the menu that appears when you right click on the control.

section.title: Choice Properties (Record List Controls)
section.description: Record List controls are bound to one or more fields in a specified table.

case.title: Table
case.description: The table which provides the data that is displayed.

case.title: Return Value
case.description: The value that will be returned to the form when a record is selected.

case.title: Filter Expression
case.description: An expression that selects which records will be displayed.

case.title: Columns in Record List
case.description: These fields that the list will display.

case.title: Watch Expression
case.description: An expression that evaluates to a logical value to determine when the list should be refreshed. The Watch Expression is not enabled until there is a Filter Expression. If you do not have a need to select a subset of your table's records, give the Filter Expression a value of .T. (all records).

section.title: Choice Properties (Other Controls)
section.description: Lists of choices can be based on system objects (e.g. field names), table values, expressions, user written functions, or static lists. Refer to the following topics for more information.
